text: bottle @ family. Appearance: pours clear red with ok soapy beige head with some lacing. aroma/taste: grain, hay, bread, vegetables, citrus and fruity notes. palette: medium carbonation, light to medium body, some maltl sweetness, average bitterness, medium duration and a watery texture. Overall: a bit thin red ale with some undesirable vegetable notes.
Amberish color with an off white head. Fine body and quite balanced. Some citrus and fruity nose. Lovely mixed flavour, fruity, caramel, hoppy malty.[Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden]
Tap at Gallows Bird, Espoo. Originally rated 28092011. Colour is clear copper with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, caramel, sweetness and malts.

Mycket dimmig-grummligt brun och lite orange med ett litet typ khaki färgat skum. Doft: Malt, kanderat socker, humle, gräddkola, kakor. Smak: Malt, besk choklad kaka, humle, humle beska, växt beska, bränt socker. Troligen en bra öl till kontinental husmans.
Flaska från SB. Grumligt mörkt kopparfärgad vätsks med lågt bubbligt skum. Dofter av säd, bröd och humle. Maltkropp med viss sötma. Sedan möter beskan upp. Lite obalanserad. Kort eftersmak.
Backlog - Bottle from Systembolaget. Caramel and dark bread with a touch of dried fruits and apricot.

330ml bottle, pours cloudy redwood colored with a small tan head that quickly reduced. Aroma of orange and lemon peels, caramel, resin and syrup loaf. Taste is lightly sweet with a medium bitterness. Palate is light-medium bodied, smooth texture and soft carbonation. A good beer for the style, but I do prefer similar but typically fuller bodies stronger American Red Ales.

Dark copper colour and slightly hazy with a decent egg-white head. Slightly sweet aroma with tropical fruits and toasted bread. The taste is sweet fruits upfront with a bitterness that builds towards the finish and leaves an aftertaste of slightly burned toast. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation. A pleasant surprise.
Bra Irish / Red - Ale humlig len arom. Rund i smaken, lagom beska. Relativt lätt i kroppen. Lätt besk eftersmak.
330 ml bottle. Slightly hazy dark amber with off white head. Aroma malty; burnt sugar, fruit and citrus. Taste of malt, roasted, caramel, fruit and grass. Decent but not great
Weak odor. The taste is good and tasty. Very fruity aroma and flavor. Good and long finish. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Det här var en torr och bitter sak med en fin smak av gräsaktig humle och en maltig kropp. Slottskällans har tidigare presenterat öl som verkligen imponerat på mig men den här hamnar inte i samma kategori.
Bottle 33 cl. A clear red amber colour with a small off-white head. An aroma of malt, citrus and spices. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter.
Flaske på Cardinaltreff nov-11: Rødbrun med flott skum. Aroma av modne bær med en bakeriduft i bakgrunnen. Overraskende røstet/brent smak.

33 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 16.04.2010
Aroma has bready malt, caramel and some toffee. Flavour has bready malt, caramel, toffee, some berries, floral notes and hints of resin. Decent.

Kaatuu lasiin rubiininpunaisena ja keskikokoisella vaahdolla. Haju on pähkinäisen humaloitu ja hyvin ruohoisen sitrushedelmäinen. Maku on alussa hyvin pähkinäinen, joka tasoittuu selkeästi. Keskivaiheilla se on jopa vetisen hedelmäinen, kunnes lopussa humalan katkeruus puree ja suuhun jää täyteläinen pähkinä. Suutuntuma on jostain ohuen ja keskitäyteläisen väliltä. Kaiken kaikkiaan tämä olut on sellainen, jossa korostuu kolme erilaista makuaaltoa, joka alussa yllätti ja sitten siihen tottuu ja nauttii.
Bottle 33 cl. Pours dark copper in color with a ehitish head. Biscuits and bread with some hay in aroma. Flavour slightly bitter but also some bready malts are quite strong in there.
33 cl. Amber, clear with a huge offwhite foamy head. Verry hoppy aroma with some spices. Nice bitter taste with a hoppy end. Like
The head is ok, the body brown. It smells grassy-dark malty, hoppy. The taste is hoppy and a bit bitter. A good one! 10/12/11/13/11/12
Bottle. Copper color with a small off-white head. Malty aroma with fruits and caramel. Flavor is malt, some fruitiness, caramel and toffee. Medium-bodied, slightly bitter aftertaste.

Dark red with a nice persistent head.  The head is not as smooth as in general Irish red ales, but nice and "sticky" (ie. sticks to the sides of the glass) nevertheless.  Very nice roasty "red" aroma, typical of Irish red ales.  The taste is pretty bitter (reported EBU 51) and balances out with some fruitiness.  Long bitter finish.

330 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours mahogany brown with a small creamy off-white head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of trace on the glass. Smell is malty sweet and rather subtle with caramel, hints of bread, sweet tropical fruits, hints of metal and citrus zest. Taste is malty, slightly sweet, slightly bitter and quite metallic with caramel, bread, floral hops, lemon zest, toasted malts and grass. Mouthfeel is slightly watery and very creamy. Finish is dry and bitter with toasted malts and grass.

33 cl, bottled. Pours cloudy red with a thin white head. Aroma: Mixed malt, cardamom, fruits. Taste: Mild sweetness, moderate bitterness (distinctive in contrast). Palate: Medium body, pretty solid. Ok.

Bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. Deep coppery body, small white creamy head. Aroma is roasty tones, red fruits and hints of nuts. Quite mild, as expected. Taste is more pronounced: almonds, roasty toffee tones and hints of peaches, mellow malts and grass. Soft to medium carbonation. Highly drinkable and well tuned indeed; what a quantum leap from the commercial versions of this style like Murphys. Nice stuff.

From SkjoldBurne, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 211211.
Red with white head. Aroma of malt. Flavor with fruit and caramel
Bottle from Alko. Clear reddish brown beer with lasting creamy off-white head. Aroma is full of grassy and citric hops. Tastes sweet and malty with nice touch from the hops. Refreshing.

330 ml bottle. Finland.
Clear copper colour with small off-white head.
Hoppy aroma with berries, mild bitterness, rose hip, malt and nuts.
Flavour is also hoppy with dry bitterness, dry salty liquorice, malt and nuts. 
Surprisingly tasty Red Ale (not my favourite style).

Bottle. Pours a deep brownish read with a medium, beige head. Aroma is pine, citrus, passion fruit, some caramel. Taste begins piney, turning into caramel and nutty malts and finishes citrusy with some caramel and woodiness and tones of nuttiness. Palate is alright, a bit light, not much carbonation.
Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours clear red/amber with a small white head. Aroma of red ripe fruits. Taste is moderate bitter resiny hops with a weak caramelly malty body. Lingering bitter.
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. heavy bitter average finish. Oily palate. great hopps and great balance. Really nice.

0.33l bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. This is a clear deep red beer with a bubbly off-white head. The aroma is red and kinda fruity, tones of sweet red berries and malty. It has a average carbonation level and a kinda watery to oily mouthfeel. Light bitter and really dry flavors. Some light burned tones mixed with fruits, malts and soap. Ends with a nice little bitter finish. Not to bad this one actually, not even after a couple of great beers that I just had.
Very forgettable beer. I suppose it was fruity and nicely malty and slightly hoppy.

Red Ale, red to brown color, small white head.
Aroma has some toasted malt, citrus, fruity esters with slightly nutty aroma.
It tastes somewhat hoppy for the style, citrus, some strawberry, toast and berries.
Has medium palate, easy to drink.
Well.. not bad at all, but to me this was just one of those drink and forget beers.

33cl bottle from Alko. Poured mahogany color with a creamy dirty white head. Aroma has caramel and fruity hops. Flavor is bitter hops, caramel and fruity notes. Finish is bitter and somewhat fruity. Great brew!

Bottle. Amber, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, fruitiness, caramel and some toffee and some nuttiness, light citrus hoppyness and light roasted malt. Body is light to medium, malty and lightly sweetish, some caramel, light citrus hoppyness and light roasted malt. Finish is average, malty and dryish, roasted malt - faint burnt malt, some citrus hoppyness. OK lightly sweetish red ale. OK hoppyness - too much caramel for me.
Bottle, pours red amber with off white head. Aroma is caramel, malt, fruits. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitterness. Medium-full body

330ml bottle from Alko

Pours dark red with a minimal sticky head. Metallic aroma has notes of fruits and hops. Taste is malty and slightly metallic with notes of exotic fruits and berries. Nice bitter and fruity finish. Slightly unbalanced, but quite good.
330 ml bottle. Clear amber colour, thin off-white head. Aroma of caramel malt, fruits, berries and hops. The flavour is dryish roasted malty, with a hint of fruit and a dry, lingering bitter finish.

Bottle 33 cl from Systembolaget - Göteborg (S). Red ale with ivory head, living sparkling. Fruity aromas, brown sugar, hop, citrus. The taste is is fruity, sugar, citrussy bitter, tonic-water, a bit salty. Fluid texture. As it warms, it takes chocolate and sour notes. Irish-US bitter with a long bitter aftertaste.
Bottle 330ml. Pours chocolate brown with a nice medium head. Strong earthy bread, vegetable aroma. Medium body, average carbonation. Not Bad.

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20101223.
Pours clear amber colour with minimal head on the sides. Flavour of light ripe fruits, dry malts, earth notes, nuts and bread. Aroma of dry fruity malts, nuts, resin, some spices, bread and light caramel and toffee at the end. Medium-bodied, dry palate with a lightly bitter finish. Quite nice.
4424

Copper brown beer with a weak and blond head. Aroma is toffeeish, wooden and slightly aromatic. Taste is biscuity, some toffee and hint of roastiness, enough of bitterness, that is wooden and dry. Quite smooth palate, nice. Some personality can be found, but overally this beer is quite boring. Dry, wooden and smooth beer.

Olut on punertavan ruskea ja niukkavaahtoinen. Tuoksussa on marjoja, karamellia, kahvia ja yrttejä. Maussa taasen on marjoja, hieman kitkerää kahvia ja sitrusta. Puumainen ja katkera ovat myös hyviä sanoja kuvaamaan tämän ruotsalaisen oluen makua. Suutuntuma on hieman ohkaisen puoleinen. Olipahan ihan kiva kertakokeilu tämäkin.
Pours dark amber with a medium tan head. Aroma is roasted malts and some alcohol. Flavor is malts, caramel, alcohol and hops. Nice.
The smell and the taste is sweet, floral hops with hints of caramel malt and coffee. Palatable hop flavor in the aftertaste. Nice!

Bottle, 5.0%. Good refreshing, grassy hop aroma. Clear dark amber/chesnut colour. OK stable tan head. The flavour starts off with a distinct bitterness, has a creamy maltiness and a good aromatic hop flavour like the aroma. Well-balanced.
Två av tre rätt och det är väl okej. Fin beska, bra humlearomer, men väl tunn kropp som inte riktigt håller ihop det.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Slightly mahogany toned, ruby beer with thin but very creamy and long lasting head. Fruity nose has some peaches, strawberries and herbal hops. Dryish maltiness with slightly rye-like roastedness and a hint of coffee beans. Slightly sour and dry finish with ligh bitterness. Light body, slighty thin finish.

Bottle.  Clear amber colour with medium creamy white diminishing head 
Heavy hoppy aroma. Bitter flavor.

Purchased at systembolaget in Uppsala on June 16, 2011. Overall, this was an excellent beer. Pours with an amber color, producing a decent off-white head. The nose is malty, mildly fruity and slightly hoppy: respectable, but nothing earth shattering. The taste starts out a bit sweet  fruity, malty, bready  and finishes mildly bitter. I detected a hint of smoked flavor in the finish. Very good beer, with a bit to be desired in the body and aroma.

Golden brown with small head. Aroma is malty and bready with big caramel, hard toffee and some dried fruits. Some chocolate notes. Medium bodied with a light sweetness. Bonus points for the nice balance.
Bottle. Thanks to konstefik! Pours clear amber with a off white head. Aromas of hops, biscuit , caramel and fruit. Flavor is malty and with a dry and bitter hoppy finish. Easy, tasty..
Clear amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - fruit. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 220711

Its red-brown with a creamy head, and the aroma has notes of hops, spruce, malt and caramel. The flavour is moderately sweet with notes of a little licorice and the same notes as the aroma. The finish is dry and a little harsh.
(on bottle)Straight up beer, to the hoppy side, some us hops in there? I guess, if judged from some style sheet, it would be too hoppy, but I had it on a hot day in good company, it´s fine and clean.
Redish amber with medium white head. Hoppy with spicy notes. malt, fruit and hops. Medium body with a nice bitter aftertaste.

330ml bottle.
Pours a clear, medium copper, with a beige head.
Quite fruity aromas, malt, toasted, faint diacetyl, fudge, hops.
Dry, medium body, medium bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty and fruity taste, hops, caramel, toffee, toasted, yeast.
Very generous, rich and tasty, high drinkability. (2011-07-02)
Bottle. Slightly hazy amber/brown with small tan head. Flavour is malt, caramel, fruit, hops, little bitter and a little nuts.

Roast and powerful hop aroma. 
Chestnut low head.
Quite bitter, good roast, agressive. 
Good body. 
Flavourfull
UPDATED: NOV 18, 2011 caramel, bread, golden, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, dry texture, lively, bitter, long finish, re-rate d.13112011 =3,6

Amber and faint hazy. Has an off-white head, mostly to fully lasting. Aroma is yeasty, malty, toasted. Flavor reveals some more nice malt, soft roasted bread, sweetness and a moderate bitter finish. Dry texture. Soft carbonation.

(Draught at Pikkulintu, 20110407) The beer poured brown and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had caramell, fruitiness and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, fruitiness, hops, caramell and bitterness. Aftertaste was bitter. Nice, tasty and easily sessionable beer from Slottskällans.Earlier Rating: 10/9/2009 Total Score: 3.5(Draught at Olutkellari Helsinki on 2009-10.08) Deep reddish brown and clear. Dense white head. Caramell, hops and malts in aroma. Medium bodied and dryish palate with medium carbonation. Malts, hops, sweetness, molasess, lightly fruitiness, bitterness and saltiness in taste. Malts, ligthly roastedness and bitterness in aftertaste.
Bottle. From notes. Reddish with an off-white head. Sweet malt, caramel, citrus. Medium-bodied.

Bottle and unfiltered from tap. Tap very much better.
Rich red colour, with a good head. 
Aroma of bread, a whole lot of malt and a good, warm fruityness.
Flavour is alittle more hoppy, alittle floral and herby, with a good carbonation, good body and medium lenght.
Summary; A really good red ale! End of storie.
UPDATED: MAY 29, 2011 Clear reddish amberbrown with a off-white head. Fruits and berries along with some resin and caramel. Nice hoppiness but maybe just a little weak on the body.

Bottle at No5, DØE tasting.
Clear dark amber with a beige head. Aroma moderate malty (caramel, roasted, fruity notes) and hoppy (citric). Medium sweet and bitter, rather complex. Medium body. Exciting.

Fick prova en ofiltrerad version på bryggeriet.
Mycket fruktig doft, len läskande kropp, lång eftersmak. Mycket gott - särskilt som matöl.

Pours dark mahogany with a rich light tanned head leaving lacing. Aroma is sour dough rye bread, malty, fruity and hoppy. Low carbonation. Thin malty mouthfeel. Hoppy, a bit acidy and fruity flavor. Carbonation gone quickly, flavor a bit dissapointing.Acidy malty palate. Finishes with a nice tart bitter shortlived aftertaste.

Tap @ Gastropub Nordic.
Pours a clear reddish brown colour with visible bubbles. Big lacy and foamy head. Aroma of strong tropical fruits, citrus and floral hops. Flavour of floral hops, citrus, caramel malts and bread. Medium bodied with loads of carbonation and foam. Not bad.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma is hoppy and some grass and floral notes. Appearance is red, very nice looking beer, with a nice foam that leaves a lot of lacing as it sinks. Taste is a little bitter but with nice balance from the malt sweetness, great beer, very drinkable.
0.33 l bottle from Systembolaget. Slightly hazy deep amber. Sweetish, caramelly and yeasty aroma. Nutty and caramelly flavor with biscuity and yeasty bitteness.  Too yeasty for me.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2011 Clear red brownish colour with a slightly yellowed soapy head that leaves some lacings. 
Lots of mineral in the aroma at first, then comes nuts, caramel, burnt butterscotch, sweet dark bread, dried fruits and grassy flowery hops.
Taste is sweet malty with marked bitterness. Butterscotch and caramell, flowery, apricots, grapefruit, oranges, nuts and a growing piney, herby and perfumey bitterness.
Medium body with soft bubbles. A good one!

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Pours off-white, foamy medium-sized head. Some lacing. Deep amber/mahogany colour. Smells of caramel malts, vanilla, hops and some fruits. Taste is medium bitter with some sweetness. A bit roasted flavour as well. Light to medium bodied. Nothing brilliant, but ok.

Flöska. reddish amber colour. Medium off-white head. Aroma of toasty malt and caramel with fruitish hops, bit berrish. Good mouthfeel. Pleasant flavour of toasty amlt and caramel with bitter fruitish hops, bit berry. Medium bitterness in the finish, pleasant.

330 ml bottle. Reddish dark mahogany. Clear. High carbonation level, but medium-sized off-white fine laced head. Soapy and papery nose. Rich malty flavours with a hint of red berries. Lactic acidity. Slightly fizzy with a crisp metallic hoppy note. Some black pepper. Dry and bitter finish.
15.10.2010, 0,33l Bottle. Amber brown reddish colour with white head. Aroma is malty with a lot of bitter hops. This beer has some sweetness but also a lot of dry bitterness. Nice refreshing ale.
Aroma is caramel, hops, orange and some sweets. Taste is american hops, spicy, caramel, good carbonation.
Orange coclor, ok head. Malty aroma with metal and berry notes. Malty flavor, a bit roasted, berries, metal.

330 ml bottle, from Systembolaget.
Clear and sparkling deep orange with a rocky light brown head that is initially 3 fingers thick an with a lasting half finger cover. Good lacing. Inviting aroma of dry light fruit, vanilla, caramel, wood, and some hoppy notes; flowers and hay. Heavy bitter and sweet flavors with a long sprucy bitter and semi-dry finish. Alcohol notes. Medium to full body. Medium carbonation. Pretty good stuff!
Bottle from Systembolaget. Ruby red with a smallish head. Hoppy caramel aroma. Bready, caramel flavours, fruity. Not at all bad, though easily forgotten.

330 ml bottle, from Systembolaget. ABV is 5.0%. Reddish brown colour, big cream-coloured head. Very nice fruity aroma (ripe berries), also strong notes of bakery and lightly toasted malts.The flavour is more roasty than the colour and aroma made me expect, notes of burnt breadcrumbs. Not entirely pleasant.

Bottled. 
Clear copper colour, with creamy off-white head. Nutty, caramelly aroma with hints of white chocolate and floral hops. Flavour is salty hoppy up front with big hop profile, still in okay balance with chocolate, rye bread, hazelnuts and suggestions of jelly fruits. This is highly bitter from start to finish, and Im sure some people think its too much, and maybe unbalanced. The mouthfeel is semi-soft, not much to mention there. The Gin & Tonic is sensed here too, I would assume its from the hop bitterness though. Thanks marsiblursi! Medium body, and not so chewy.
Clear red colour with off-white head. Fruity and caramel aroma. Medium to high bitterness.

(Bottle) Pours dark orange red with a creamy off-white head. The aroma is of burned crisp bread, dark bread, bread spices, mild earthy toffee/caramel, biscuits, mild chocolate and grassy/floral hops. I like the malt bill - light burned and full. Citric, fruity, resinous, light piny and bell pepper-like acid qualities in the background. Alcohol, hops and a whisper of phenols reminds me of gin and tonic. The flavour is light sweet, medium bitter and light acidic. Citric and mild roasted. The mouthfeel is a bit too clean but the malt brigs some chewiness to the palate. Medium carbonated. Earthy and resinous citric finish that holds a whisper of burned cookies. Medium bodied.

High head. Rich fragrance. A very fullbodied ale loaded with hops and and herbal tinted oak. Some sugar and caramel, a little smoke, but only a hint. A beer I like to drink again and agin. Pity they sell in such small bottles.

Bottle from Secret Santa and served in standard pint glass: Mahogany reddish hue with a beige frothy head and good lace. The aroma has notes of grassy and piney hops, hint of citrus fruits, caramel and biscuity malts, some minerals and earthy esters. The taste is equal smart with a more hop forward profile then often found within the genre (not to say it is very bitter, just more than normal and APAish like) with a mild grainy and bready background with a touch of hop spice upon the finish, consistent citric fruitiness throughout. The mouth feel is sprite and refreshing abit a tad chalky. Overall this is among the better examples of the style I have come across, that said it then is not really to style either. Yummy!

Bottle.

Bottle. Pours a reddish-brown color with a cremy white head. Aroma was fruity and hoppy also some bread. Flavor was about the same. Quite sweet with some caramel. Finish was hoppy.

Smell is fruity, hops,roasted malts, ordinary malt, citrus

Beautiful ruby colour, creamy dirty whte head.

Flavour is hoppy, floral and fruity.

Mouthfeel is sad to say a bit flat..

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy pale reddish color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy hoppy flowery aroma. Sweetish fruity malty spicy hoppy flavor with some hints of caramel. Has a sweetish malty spicy hoppy finish.

Bottle 330ml.Clear medium amber color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, caramel. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20091123]

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2010 Medium offwhite head. Red body. Fruity floral roasty caramel aroma with meaty papery notes. Dry wooden roasty spicy lacquer taste with dusty caramel and chocolate notes. Dry roasty wooden papery aftertaste with dusty bitter grass and caramel notes. Very nice. (0.33l bottle, Systembolaget, Charlottenberg. Rated twice.)

courtesy of Per - pours a hazy dark reddish colour under a little persistent beige foam; fair hoppy nosed with flowery and fruity notes; cream and berries; medium malt backbone, velvety palate and with a solid bitterness, dry and very long bitter fruity and slightly peppery finish

Bottle: clear deep red colour, with a bit thin head. Aroma of lots of citrus, flowers,caramelly nose in the end. Flavor was smouth creamy  mouth feeling of caramelly, citrus and flowers. Thin to medium body, medium fruity finish.

Bottle, bought @ Systembolaget, Hyltebruk.
Pours a nice caramelly amber with a great, medium, staying, creamy, off-white head. Great duration. Heavy malty aroma, caramel, sweetness, some flowery and fruity hops as well. Medium carbonation, rather light mouthfeel. Flavour is heavy malty again, but there is a heavy, even a little sharp, bitterness. Piney, fruity. Light liqourice, chocolate and metal notes as well. But quite drinkable, though.

Bottle.
This was a nice surprice. Fine and complex malty body giving the foundation to a wonderful citrus hoppiness. Immensly drinkable, Ill be sure to pick up more of this when next in Sweden!
Bottle. Reddish hazy body with a medium off white head. Sweet malty aroma with notes of fruit and light hops. Light hoppy flavour with notes of fruit and caramel. Ends up hoppy bitter.

Pours Copper red with a large light brown head which nicely laces the glass. Aroma is full of raisin bread with grapefruit and with a nice aroma background of herbal and spicy hops. Flavor is rather sweet and hoppy with a nice bittersweet liquorice finish. An excellent brew.
Bottle at Papsøs - Thanks. Clear amber - white head. Caramel, toasted, roasted notes, honey notes, sweetness, hay, straw, grainy, chocolate, earthy, mould, nice malty, citrussy, medium hoppy.

Clear brown, small light brown head,
mild caramelly toffee aroma.
flavor is sweet hoppy caramelly.
faint buttery.
Clear amber with a medium off white head. Sweet malty aroma with spicy and caramel notes. Flavour was fairly sweet with plenty of hops, malt and caramel notes. Finished bitter.not bad.

Bottled. Amber coloured. Unclear. Light brown dense head. light roast, berries, light spice, light roast in the aroma. Flavour of caramel, cocoa, herbs, flowers, spice. Medium bodied. Dry roasty and bitter end.

Bottle 33 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours a clear amber with a small, off-white head. Lovely aroma hops in the nose - somewhat citric. Medium body, sweet caramel and aromatic hops leaving a solid bitternes. Nice one. 231109

Red amber with a nice thick tan head. Aroma explosion here. Fruity and sweet with hints of chocolate and a nice mixture of hops. Fresh complex flavor, fruit, caramel, chocolate and loads of those perfectly mixed hops. Does not come as sweet as many others in this category, somewhat dry but still in perfect balance. Finally they hit the red bullseye with this ale. It´s a really great ona.

Bottled. Pours out in a clear dark reddish amber colour with a firm white foam. Rather hoppy aroma of spices, hay and lemon-zest with mild undertones of burnt caramel. Medium-bodied with rather bitter notes of grass, spices, wormwood and lemon-zest with sweetish malty undertones of fudge. Long medium-bitter finish of grass, wormwood and spices.
Bottle. Nice head with medium duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich on hops with a good long bitter finish. But also caramel, nuts, fruits and notes of citrus.

0.33 L bottle from Systembolaget, Charlottenberg.  Big tan head. Clear, reddish-brown body.  Slight peppery, toasted malts, toffee and tinned fruits in the aroma. Much of same flavorwise; Medium sweet, toasted, lightly spiced, nutty and caramelly malts. Som fruit tones and a just enough of the bittering hops added, to balance. Mid-bodied. Lingering malty-bitter ending. Well-crafted and moreish.
Bredd i smaken, precision i beskan. Träffar helt rätt med sin yviga och viltblomstrande smakbild. Sitter som ett cricketslagträ i bakhuvudet, som Dave Mustaine skulle ha uttryckt saken.

330ml bottle, being one of the better beers that we picked up shopping at Systembolaget in Kiruna. Deep, dark amber body with ruby tints. Bubbly, off-white head. Pleasant aroma of fruity malts. Well balanced flavour of malts and spiced fruits. Rounded ending with clear-cut hop bitterness. To my liking (shared with Finn, Elsas in Skibotn, 31.10.2009).

Flaske 0,33l kjøpt på Systembolaget i Kiruna og delt med Rune på Elsas Skibotn 31 Okt 09. Dyp rød på farge. Pent svakt farget kremaktig skum som nesten blir helt borte. Nydelig aroma med tyggegummi og frukt. Variert fruktig smak. Fin fruktig bitterhet i ettersmaken  som varer lenge.

33 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden dark orange with a small off-white head. Aroma is crisp hops fruity and vague spiced. Bitter, peachy, light grapefruity and light citrusy flavoured. Bitterand citrusy to peachy hoppy finish with a light roasted malt touch.

Bottled. A deep red beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, caramel, and over ripe fruits - a bit cloying. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and caramel lesing to a dry lightly bitter and nutty finish. The body is thin.

Bottle. Dark red colour with an off-white head. Aroma: lightly roasted, caramel, fruit, chocolate, pine, some grassy green notes. Flavor: lightly roasted, pine, caramel, grass, wood, light fruitiness. Harsh, husky bitterness. Dry finish. Thin mouthfeel.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2011 Keg (Olutkellari, Helsinki) (6:4:7:4:14=3.5)
Deep red, small tight head. Sweet caramelly aroma - fruity hops too. Crisp carbonation. Sweetmalty body, but massive fruity hops there too - fleshy fruits, but spicy too. Some almond too. Finish is very almondy to me, but Anna doesnt get that. Long and bitter, sticky and a touch dry. One of the best red ales I remember. (Not that I acknowledge it as a meaningful style).
Rerate: Tap (Pikkulintu, Helsinki)
5 Bit of a grainy aroma, a bit acidic.
4 Hazy copper.
5+ Red grapefruit pips
3 Simple palate. Long bitter finish
11 Quite lagery, in everything from the aroma to the finish. But nicely grainy. So much worse than the previous one.

Dark coppery colored with medium sized yellow head. Grassy hopped biting aroma with thin chocolate and slight burnt tone. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is similar with biting grassy notes, some licoricy-chocolate also here. Still too biting hops here, not in balance.

Bottle. Pours a red color with a nice white head. Lots of citrus, grapefruit and flowers in the aroma, hints of toffee. Flavour is hoppy with lots of citruse, pine and grapefruit with some light balancing caramel. Long bitter finish. Light to mediumbodied. A surprisingly hoppy beer, didnt expect that...

It poured a clear dark reddish liquid with a medium sized dirty that left allot of lacing.

It had a sweet smell of hops, flowers, rosehip and malt.

It tasted similar of hops, grass and flowers. It didnt have  very thick body and was a bit watery. Some stingyness at the back of my mouth. Decent beer but not really my kind of beer.

Pleasantly toffee-aromatic-hoppy nose with a touch of berries. Berry-aromatic, dryish and lightly ashy flavor with toffee and a touch of acidity. Almost medium body with medium carbonation. Nice aromatic hops slightly spoiled by the ashy stuffiness.
Bottle, 33cl - Copper red beer with a medium head. Aroma is fruity with notes of floral hops, citrus and caramel. Flavor is malty with notes of caramel and woody hops. Balanced.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Deep red-brown. SMall tan head.
Toffee-ish aroma with hoppy notes.
Chewy and sweet mouthfeel. Toffee, caramelle and fine hoppiness.
Pretty late and dry bitterness.
Bottled:Clear reddish brown. Thick head. Fruity caramell aroma with notes of hops. Caramell and chocolate flavour with light roastiness. Long, metallic bitterness.

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget.On October 7, 2009BB 11-10Clear nice reddish copper color, smallish tan ehad. Herbal hoppy, malty sweet, nettles grassy green peppers, some chocolate scent. Thin, dry, harsh bitter taste, chalky. Long dry chalky husky aftertaste. Thin mouthfeel, dry husky unpleasant bitterness.
Bottle (33 cl), thanks gnoff & deft.Clear copper, medium beige head. Caramelly malt aroma with piney and citric hops. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. A bit salty and harsh bitterness.

Bottle from Systembolaget.

Malty slightly belgian aroma.
Burnt taste and sharp mouthfeel.
Nice beer with a fair amount of grapefruity hops and a refreshing bitterness in the finish that lingers on. Not at all your traditional red ale, but still tasty.

Aroma is fruits, quite strong n the malts along with some slight zesty and mild earthy notes. Flavour is caramel malts along with some zest, fruits and wooden notes. Mild herbal notes as well. Pleasant and balanced brew.

(Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival, 19 Sep 2009) Reddish amber colour with brief head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of orange peel and caramel. Malty, fruity taste with caramel, orange peel, toffee and a spicy, fairly dry finish. Medium body. Nice and tasty beer.

Bottle 10 C
AP: lovely high head, bigg bubbels - red in colour
AR: American hops, tonic water, some fruit - apricote?
F: Dosent  taste what the apperance and aroma promised - I guess that its better on draft. American hops, tonic water, some fruit - apricote, medium ++ bitterness
AF: clings on for a wile

Bottle from Systembolaget.  Beautiful dark reddish color, but prfoundly disappointing in taste. No caramel or malty features to balance the strong but untasty combo of american and english hops.  Boring british hops with boring beer. Disappointed.

Dark amber-red color, small white head. Grassy, vegetably aroma. Caramel malty flavor has also grassy and vegetably notes. Lingering bitterness. Ok red ale with extra hoppyness. (7/3/7/3/13 3.3)

Deep amber color, small off-white head, some lace. A bit vegetably, sweetish, slightly exotic fruity aroma. Light to medium-bodied. Base is malty, caramelly then quite snappy hoppyness. Nice, bitterish brew. (7/4/7/3/13 3.4)
Draught (Stockholm Beer Festival 2009) - Brown/red in colour. Hoppy aroma with grapefruit, caramel and spicy malt. Hoppy and malty taste with spicy malt, tangy hops, grapefruit and caramel.

Draught at Stockholm Beer and Whisky 2009.
Clear amber coloured with a medium sized off white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, grass and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops, grass, pine needles and grape fruits.
Dry hoppy finish.

Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival.  Copper colour, small head. Floral orangey nose. Mid-sweet with clean mouthfeel. Light bodied and mildly roasty with floral peaty undertones. Reallly bitter finish.Nicely drinkable.
